bibl.title: Settling a Dispute in Fourth Century Small Oasis (P. Mich. Inv. No. 4008).
bibl.note: A settlement has been reached privately as a result of a dispute that arose between the centurions Flavius Lalachios, on the one hand, and Flavius Lalachos, on the other, along with relatives of Lalachios' late wife. The dispute was not over property rights, but over the epinemesis (compulsory cultivation). The papyrus (AD 364) is the latest in date to come from the Small Oasis.
bibl.seg: GAGOS Traianos and P.J. SIJPESTEIJN, Settling a Dispute in Fourth Century Small Oasis (P. Mich. Inv. No. 4008).
ZPE 105 (1995) pp. 245-252, 1 arbre généal. et pl. VI.

A settlement has been reached privately as a result of a dispute that arose between the centurions Flavius Lalachios, on the one hand, and Flavius Lalachos, on the other, along with relatives of Lalachios' late wife. The dispute was not over property rights, but over the epinemesis (compulsory cultivation). The papyrus (AD 364) is the latest in date to come from the Small Oasis.
